longInfo:
Passport required.
- Passports and other documents accepted for entry must be
  valid for a minimum of 6 months from the arrival date. 
Passport Exemptions:
- Holders of a German identity document ( Kinderausweis )
  issued to minors.
- Holders of emergency and temporary passports.

Visa Issuance:
Visa required, except for Nationals of Germany can obtain a
visa on arrival for a max. stay of 30 days. Fee: USD 30.-.
Extensions possible.
Minors:
- Minors traveling unaccompanied must hold a written approval
  from the parents and a contact address in Rwanda.
- WARNING! In accordance with European Union (EU) Legislation,
  all minors who are nationals of Germany will be expected to
  hold their own passport or National ID Card (where
  applicable) when departing from Bulgaria, Croatia, Cyprus,
  Romania or a Schengen Member State . 
Additional Information:
- Extension of stay possible within 15 days of arrival, at the
  Directorate General of Immigration and Emigration.
Warning:
- Nationals of Germany who have visited Guinea, Liberia or
  Sierra Leone within the last 22 days will be refused entry.
  Exempt are holders of special authorization signed by the
  Minister of Health of The Republic of Rwanda
vaccination:
Vaccinations not required.

Recommended:
- Vaccination against yellow fever for all passengers over 1
  year of age.
  Malaria prophylaxis: malaria risk, mainly due to P.
  falciparum, exists throughout the year in the whole country.
  Recommended prevention: C.
